channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: ‘Divinity: Original Sin 2 - Definitive Edition’ comes the iPad
item.description: The title has been rebuilt from the ground up using Apple's Metal APIs.

item.title: NVIDIA brings its performance-enhancing DLSS to VR games
item.description: 'No Man's Sky' is among the three virtual reality titles getting the upgrade this month.

item.title: Here's why AirPods Max don't support Apple Music Lossless
item.description: Apple Music's entire library will be available in lossless soon, but it won't work with AirPods Max. Here's why that's the case.

item.title: Washington DC dismantles its secretive facial recognition system
item.description: Last fall, we learned that Washington, DC police used a previously-undisclosed facial recognition system to identify a protester who allegedly punched a law enforcement officer during the June 2020 Layfette Square riots. Privacy advocates will be happy to know that the system, which was used by 14 federal and local agencies, is being shut down soon.

item.title: The next MacBook Pros may pair Apple silicon with 64GB of RAM
item.description: Apple's redesigned 14- and 16-inch MacBook Pros will reportedly pack new chips that support up to 64GB of RAM, not to mention four Thunderbolt ports.

item.title: 'Mass Effect Legendary Edition' makes the original game tolerable
item.description: Mass Effect Legendary Edition has arrived, and I’m so thankful that the original Mass Effect got the heaviest overhaul when it comes to gameplay and graphics. This is the definitive way to play the Mass Effect trilogy, even if the first game is still a struggle.

item.title: Learn how to fund and run your startup with this expert-led training package
item.description: The Complete CEO Startups Venture Capital Bundle teaches you how to run and fund your business or startup. Lifetime access to 17 hours of expert instruction makes this course one you can return to whenever you need to refresh on business best practices.

item.title: Volocopter shows off its vision for a commuter drone taxi
item.description: Or, crazy thought, you could just take a bus.

item.title: 'Grand Theft Auto V' comes to PS5 and Xbox Series X/S on November 11th
item.description: 'Grand Theft Auto V' and 'GTA Online' will be available on PS5 and Xbox Series X/S on November 11th.

item.title: Amazon invests in an electric aircraft maker to further its climate goals
item.description: Amazon has invested in electric aircraft maker Beta Technologies to help its reach its climate targets.

item.title: Apple accused of giving Chinese government control over local data
item.description: Apple has allegedly handed control of CHinese customer data to a state-owned company in China, according to a new report detailing its cybersecurity failures and compliance with local censors.

item.title: Amazon's Echo Frames will soon come with blue-light filtering lenses
item.description: You'll soon be able to get Amazon's Echo Frames with blue-light-filtering lenses.

item.title: Apple iMac M1 review: The ideal portable desktop
item.description: Apple’s new iMac brings together the snappy performance of its M1 chip with a sharp redesign that makes it at home practically anywhere. With its gorgeous screen and surprisingly capable speakers, it’s pretty much the perfect family computer. And it’s so light, you won’t mind moving it from room to room.

item.title: Apple's 512GB Mac Mini M1 drops back down to $800 at Amazon
item.description: Save $100 on Apple's Mac Mini M1 with 512GB of storage at Amazon.

item.title: London will open electric scooter trials in June
item.description: London will begin shareable e-scooter trials next month operated by micromobility providers Lime, Dott and TIER.

item.title: McLaren reveals the $225k Artura, its first production hybrid supercar
item.description: McLaren has been in the business of making ludicrously light and fast supercars for years but it wasn’t until 2021 that the company put one of its High-Performance Hybrid (HPH) designs into full production. Say hello to the $225,000 Artura.

item.title: Wacoal's AI-powered myBraFit app scans your body to give you sizing advice
item.description: Wacoal debuts myBraFit, an AI-powered bra-sizing app.

item.title: Lamborghini plans to launch its first fully electric car before 2030
item.description: Lamborghini stands out from other supercar makers for a lack of EVs or hybrids, but the Italian automaker has finally unveiled its electrification plans.

item.title: The Morning After: Apple Music adds lossless streaming to its entire catalog
item.description: Today’s headlines: AT&T's WarnerMedia is merging with Discovery, Apple Music adds Dolby Atmos and lossless streaming starting next month, Samsung teases its next generation of flexible displays.

item.title: Fitbit's Sense smartwatch falls to a new low of $240 at Amazon
item.description: This is your chance to grab Fitbit's Sense smartwatch for $90 less than its original price: It's now available for $240 on Amazon.

item.title: Professional tuner says Apple TV's auto-calibrator doesn't deliver
item.description: YouTube channel HDTVTest suggests Apple TV's calibration feature doesn't provide its intended results on popular television sets.

item.title: Beats' true wireless 'Studio Buds' surface without AirPods stems
item.description: Beats might be set to release a new pair of wireless earbuds that look considerably different from other Apple earphone products, judging by a leak.

item.title: Intel's next-gen hybrid Optane SSDs are coming to laptops soon
item.description: Optane memory H20 is a new storage product from intel that combines its high-performance Optane memory with a regular QLC SSD in capacities of 512GB and 1TB.

item.title: New iPad Pro shipments continue to slip as Apple faces display production issues
item.description: According to Bloomberg, Apple is dealing with supply chain issues that could leave buyers waiting weeks for their new 12.9-inch iPad Pro.

item.title: Amazon is reportedly negotiating to buy MGM
item.description: Amazon is reportedly considering a $9 billion acquisition that would make it the owner of franchises like James Bond, Stargate and Robocop.
